tasks.name: Work Out!
tasks.description:
Pick a location:
Backyard, Frontyard, Street, Basement, Living Room, Office Bedroom, Garage, Bathroom

Then choose, 
Productive, playful, intense

And finally, set a playlist and sing and dance. 

We are beating the evil sadness out by being a joyous light today. More light brings greater joy. Try out a bunch of mashups from above. Experiment, live. Invite others to join, but it's not for them, it's for you and they can either join you or not. Don't do any less because they are there. The more you do it alone the more you will know if you are holding back or shy. Shine baby shine!! üòÉüõ©Ô∏èü¶ñüå∫

journal.title: Conference Sunday Evening
journal.content:
Elder Bednar is teaching me about being an Agent. 
-to-
Love one another and choose God. 

How can I use this tool to coordinate my agency and become all that He would have me be? ü§îüß°

Elder Bednar is so smart. I can tell he is humble. He likely has been learning continually and at a deep studious level for many years, if not his whole life. His judgement is not perfect, however, his understanding of "things as they really are" grows ever brighter, as he continues to learn line by line, never (at least he tries to never) allowing himself to be proud, while always (as best he can) offering that a person will be better off listening to the spirit than to him. 

The guy after elder Bednar 
Cory? 

By which name are *you* called?

"You can count the seeds in an apple, but you can not count the apples that will or have come from a that seed."

Guy after "Not Mother" 
Jonah, God loves all of his children. 
My mom said she might watch conference for the last hour and a half! üòÉü•∞‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©π

Godoy
No complaints, only smiling faces and grateful hearts. Do I know where to find help and hope?

journal.title: Notes for this app
journal.content:
The journal needs to use the same formatting to display it in the list as it has in the input field I am typing this in now. Right now it just comes out in a solid paragraph. And if someone writes a really long one, it should cut off at some point and have a show more/show less option.

Ps, a "select icon" modal should be available to pick an icon in advanced settings for the journals weekly goal associated icon. Good job setting the default to the bullseye, however, when they want to change it to a different one I do not want them to have to look it up. Can the modal open here too and apply it's choice to the correct input for this weekly goals icon? 

Oh no the tasks are completing wrong. Oh no oh no. This is a big deal! We need to be very careful and make affectionate and accurate fixes here. I need to look into this first -> readme this as a to-do for now until I can look into it. 

I just realized stuff from the next day is not making it into the current day on day view and stuff from the following week is not showing up on the current week. Eg, the "sleep" task due at 5:30am the following day (and sometimes the following week) is not showing up on the night of the current day (or the night of the last day of the current week) maybe we can have it actually load the both, (today and next day, this week and the next week) and just don't show the last day... Not sure if that will work, hmm, another idea? Maybe just have a second object created of the next day or next week (depending on what is being displayed) and then know that it needs to include those in the calculations and show any that should be present. This might be difficult so if it needs its own update so we can give it appropriate attention put it in the readme to do list too. 

I took a screenshot of the two tasks I have that are being weird. The sleep one should probably be yellow, and I suppose.

journal.title: App updates needed October 7th observation
journal.content:
Lol, apparently I need a show more than on my weekly goals to, including on the dashboard, if that is even possible! üòÑ‚ù§Ô∏èüíßü•∞ü¶äüòÅü¶ùüê©üêæüõ©Ô∏èüß°ü¶Ñüôèü§çüïäÔ∏èüòã

Added more: 
Not sure if the logic is working right for confirming multiple completions or misses/failures when it comes to adding them to historical tasks, as I am not seeing them populate in my calendar. :'( üò¢

Inserted from weekly goal so the weekly goal wouldn't feel like a back log üòä

Implement a little color wheel that shows how much time you spend doing each category each week (using the colors from the categories and having a little legend beneath it too or to the side depending on screen size I would think would be okay). Remember to have it check for both current AND historical tasks in the given week.

I also would like to see the optional feature to allow it to ask how long a task took each time and get that tracking in historical as well and then also using a running average of the latest several to know about how long it will take to complete a task. And I think I had it written out somewhere but once the user is done using the feature and goes to turn it off it will ask if you want to update all the expected time taken variables to match the new average from the data gathered. And maybe a ln option in the advanced options by the only to turn it on and off to also set how far back the average should go, and it should be a time period, not a number and the default should be 1 years since that is how far back we expect to remember tasks anyway.

Maybe there could be an automatically delete historical tasks after option too and it could be set to never to start but have all sorts of options for people. Like an input for a number and then an input for a time unit from minutes to hours to days/weeks/months and even years! Same goes for the averaging feature, though this makes me want to get the database going even more or even better could be integration with their cloud email accounts so that it can not have to save on my server. :) and they will always have a copy anywhere they go! :D

I suppose this means I will need to revamp the method for storing all these objects so that it is more sensical so it will be ready to put into the cloud in a way that not only can be ready easy by the app on all their devices, but also so they could go in and edit it or look at it with the help of an ai maybe and understand their info in whatever way they want! I could imagine all sorts of cool charts being made! The ai would even be able to smartly group tasks that are easier or harder for you or notice you like doing the spiritual stuff but not the physical stuff or vice versa or maybe work is easy but home is hard or vice versa. :) and then somehow we got to get people so they can share tasks! But that will indeed require database and paying for an account and that is not part of this week's scope as I still have a checkride I want to be ready for by the end of this week Saturday night. And I am doing a bachelor's party that night so we really get to rest the ability of this app to coordinate my business and plan it so I can finish it all before it is due!! ü•∞üòÅü¶äüêæüõ©Ô∏èüß°ü¶ÑüôèüïäÔ∏è‚ù§Ô∏èüòÅüíßü•∞ü¶ùüê©üòÅ

The planner icon for weekly goals shows up properly when they are sorted by icon, but not when sorted by date. The icon should appear already both times. :)

journal.title: More update ideas
journal.content:
When I swipe on a day or week it should automatically apply the appropriate 
next > or prev < 
button, so that it travels to that page of the calendar view. :)

The month view is messed up 
It needs to just have the dots and then a tiny bit of text and each day should be scrollable so that the calendar stays a good vertical fixed height too. The dot should represent the category color and the text should just be the name of the task but once it runs out of space it goes to ellipsis... And they are just ordered by the time they are due according to the 4 step process the tasks always go through to decide their orders. Yea? Neigh? What do you think of this change? Or should we keep the big ol blocks and just make it scrollable and have the text not overlap like it is doing currently? I kind of like the dots, and if a task happens more than once on the same day in a row it should just have a x10 or x3 or whatever, how we many times it repeats next to it, but if they show up one at a time between other tasks it should be showing up each time the x2 or x5 or whatever is only to prevent it from showing up twice or more times next to itself. :) make sense? ü§îüß°ü¶äü¶ùüê©üêæüõ©Ô∏èü•∞üòÅüòòü§óüòÅüòÖü•∞ü¶äü¶ùüêæüõ©Ô∏èüïäÔ∏èü§çüôèü¶ÑüòÅ

The add new task modal is not closing/going away when I click save task

journal.title: Fix tasks
journal.content:
The first time somebody shows up to the task manager or any of these anyway this app in general, it should ask them what their favorite color is and they should have a color picker that they can choose from and I guess there should be an option that says no thanks and anyway if they choose a color it should get saved as the theme for the website and if they choose no thanks it should just use default, and it should always start set to Auto as far as day night mode goes. 

Choose icon is not working here in the new entry for Journal ...
Nor is it working in edit entry...

I think it's on the details modal for the task I am looking at, it has an edit button here but when I clicked it, nothing happened. Could you make that edit button work? 

The delete button on the task details modal is not working either. It used to ask me to confirm delete, and tell em the history will not be deleted. And then I would either confirm or not. Would you reimplement this?


Will you look if there are more icons we can add from awesome fonts (I think that is what it was called, just the one we have already been using) and if there are more, can you just add like double or triple the options? And if you can add some radio buttons at the top of the little modal to change it from "solid" to any of the other options that would be cool too. :) thank you so much for your help here! Please take your time and be thorough. Thanks! üôè‚ù§Ô∏èüòÅüõ©Ô∏èüêæüìöüçÇü¶Ñ

journal.title: Updates
journal.content:
Make it so for timer and count tasks the amount of time calculation for coordinating the time remaining related demerit is shortened by the amount of already completed portion of the task. 

So for example if a timer task usually takes 30 minutes and I have completed 15 minutes if it, then when normally my demerit would be saying -1.5 to the GPA it would only be minusing . 75

The easiest way I can think to do this is just take a ratio of how much is completed and multiply it by the demerit value. 
Another example is the count task that already has 5 out of 8 done so we would first get the ratio of 5/8 and then multiply that by the demerit value, so if the demerit is currently 0, nothing will happen, but if the demerit is -2.6 since it is coming up on being due soon that would mean we multiple 5/8 by -2.6 and this gives us the value we will actually use for the status calculations and other logistical calculations (not affecting historical GPA at all since that is a completely different formula).

Does that make sense? 

Oh also the little menu that pops up when a person visits for the first time AND they have not yet set a color theme, that menu, seems to not be quite the right styles, eg. The color picker seems to be a different Tahoe than the ones in the advanced menu (which I like the advanced menu one better) and the buttons at the bottom are not in the same styles as the rest of the app. Will you look into this as well?

Gracias! 

I should be able to click on the KPI graphs and it take me to the task's stat page. :) yeah? 

Confirm partial completion when there is part of a count but not the whole thing or part of a timer but not the whole timer amount when it comes due. It could also still allow for editing the amount in the count or timer and if it gets full it could be switch to the normal fill completion confirmation yes/no.

journal.title: New feature
journal.content:
Adding an option to take a note on historical task instances, it will be attached to that instance and will also show up in the journal on that day/time the task was completed. 

And it will have the same symbol the task did. I think this is a great way to be reflective of certain tasks like for mental health reflecting or if an interview went well. Maybe the "current" task could have notes taken too and then it saves it to the historical task that will be made from that particular current task? 

For now i don't think I can have it add any notes to the future ones, so if someone wants there future tasks to have notes they will have to put it in the description which should be showing up on the details page when the task is looked at. Can you be sure it is there? 

Okay, that's all for now. Can you do this all for me please? üõ©Ô∏èü¶úüôèüòÅüêæü§îü¶Ñüß°ü¶äüòÅü•∞üíúüí§ü§óüçÇü¶âüíßüòÅüê©üê©ü¶äü¶ÑüòÅü§îüêæü•∞üõ©Ô∏èüòÅüìöüåûüïäÔ∏èüòÅ

journal.title: Update again
journal.content:
The weekly goal needs to save in a similar way that the journals save. Basically the weekly goal will need a flag saying it is a weekly goal so the app kind find a way to update it's icon from the chosen icon in the advanced options menu, but otherwise it should save and be editable just like the journal entries. I suppose the flag will help it sort to the top of the week when sorted by date as well, and it should say the week like 10/5/25 - 10/11/25 or whatever the week was it was being saved for.

After it saves the previous week at midnight on the transition day from one week to the next (or whenever it is doing that currently) I need the app to clear the weekly goal on the dashboard so it is ready to write a new one. 

Will you add into the data migration to fix the journal entries too if there is anything wrong with them? Just like the tasks if a new variable is made or something, but for journal entries (which includes the weekly goal one.)

Maybe the weekly goals could auto populate a journal entry but it won't solidify it into the journal "archives" until the week passes, like, it would just be displaying the current week's goals there.

Also, for the goals and for the pie chart we need to be able to be able to look at different weeks. Can you add a prev current and next set of buttons for navigating the weeks and make sure they are displaying the correct sets of data? I want to be able to make goals ahead of time or edit previous week goals here (which would update in the journals spot, and I suppose if future week goals were written those would start appearing in the journal area too, except they would be in the future meaning they would almost always be shown first (unless sorted by icon, but then they still get shown first.) avoid putting any placeholder text in the weekly goals since I do not want a user accidentally creating a bunch of weekly goal journal entries on accident and of course the edit and delete buttons still need to work. 

Can you get all that? What is that, like 8 or 9 steps? Please and thank you!

journal.title: Church today
journal.content:
Hugs are nice. :) 
So is the sacrament. :)
I decided on a favorite hymn from the old hymn book this week and a favorite from the new one. 335 and 1050. 

Had a dream last night someone was very distraught, Noah Spangeburg (or however it is supposed to be spelled) and he was not sure if a girl and her were going to stay together or not. There were so many supportive pilots in the small space and we were all there for him. Everyone one of us offered comfort via a hug and words of encouragement. 
This is how I feel with the ATP experience too. Everyone cares so much more for each other than just a classmate. At Provo I was called brother at least 3 times in my less than 24 hours there. Beautiful. üß°

Kenzie Thomas is saying ma ma, ma ma, ma ma, it's really cute and loud, but Jade and I are happy to hear her using her words rather than just noises and crying. 

Each person, just like each pilot, has overcome some really hard things to get to where they are. Remember this and that will help you have charity, even when you don't yet know the details. 

Leandro, a missionary experience, needed to repent but didn't want to, but didn't know how to pray, and after his first prayer, his first real heartfelt earnest prayer, he was strengthened but he spirit and decided he Did want to keep the commandments and get married and get baptized. 

Celestial Kingdom, Jesus Christ and Repentance. Like little ducklings, be sure you do your best to be in His line. üíôü¶Üüê§üê§üê§

journal.title: Fixes
journal.content:
I haven't refreshed but the icon sorting is still messed up and the weekly goals are not loading in the right days in the journal, like for the week that started the 19th it is showing up on the 18th which puts it in the wrong week, though it is appropriately at the top of the week even though it is the wrong week, and I still think it deleted my old weekly goals.. :( so the saving the weekly goals and rightly calling them to populate both the dashboard and the journals process needs strengthened/fixed. 

The tasks showing "task due: done missed" are not showing up on the calendar at all.

journal.title: Weekly Goal
journal.content:
Put all my tasks into this task manager for
Chores, Self-Care, PPA, Family, Faith, and For Fun.

journal.title: Ideas 10/21
journal.content:
Done 
Add cut off day for repeating tasks as an option in new task and edit task, so that the repeating doesn't continue forever, but never cut off is the default. 

And the default for misses allowed should be 1 if nothing is put in but the box is checked to "track misses."

Add an "unplanned" or "free time" category to the dashboard's pie chart representing the remaining time leftover in a week unplanned 
Maybe if the amount of time that is unplanned is at or over 30% of the week total time then call it "unplanned,"  but if the time leftover is less then 30% we can call the category "free time."

With this the pie chart doesn't seem to be grabbing all the right stuff. Maybe it needs to use the times from the month view on the calendar? Since that appropriately cuts the tasks to show it within the week? That way if something overlaps one week into the next it appropriately gets the amount of that item that is actually within the date range (which is currently only available in weekly chunks, does this make sense?)

journal.title: Fix
journal.content:
Half Done
Look into why in sort by due date on the task manager the end of month seems to be taking priority over the end of week or end of next week headers/options. If the end of the month is actually sooner than the end of the week this is fine, but it should not be showing end of month if the thing is due in 4 days and it is the middle of the month currently. And the end of the month one shouldn't be able to get bumped up to be in front of anything past end of week. Since end of day and end of tomorrow are better than end of month. Just like next 8 hours is better than end of day if it is late, etc. 

Idea for advanced/precision color status update. Take into account the time between intervals or the time between when I was put in and when it is due. So if something is due every six months it will turn yellow a couple of weeks before instead of just 5 minutes or an hour before. Brainstorm ideas here, I think using the categories of time periods could help the more categories there are the less impact each one could have? Just an idea? And it could have more of an impact if there were more categories total since the less categories ones are likely to already have it covered. Or maybe it could multiply the time required factor by the number of categories it has crossed? But then if it is zero that would help? Maybe extend it by the factor of number if categories crossed? Like the thresholds???

journal.title: Fixxx
journal.content:
Half Done
Is there not a home and family section for the icons from font awesome? Like I want a house and a family or something like it. Can you add a section for Home & Family to our icon options with maybe 12-20 new icons to choose from please? If there are any, maybe a cleaning or cooking section too? Maybe we could add another 20-30 icons to the rest of the categories (total, not to reach category!) just to give a few more options in each one? Specifically the animals section and anything that could be helpful for our task app like cooking and cleaning or other daily/weekly task related things? Is there a walk the dog or feed the cat kind of one? You know a bowl of kibble? Or maybe a bowl of cereal? Anyway so all in all we are adding only about 50 new icons being sure to at least add the Home & Family header at least.

Calendar category filters is not useful. I do not like the two options right now. I think it is messy and doesn't have enough design thought into it. Hire yourself or someone else to give it a UI/ux overhaul. I also am pretty sure what is currently in place is not functioning, so that will need updated/fixed to actually handle the week/month/day option which should really be all, day/week, month as the three options, and then when I turn some thing off I can't remember which, it doesn't actually work as expected until I click the other one off too. One of them is working and the other one is only partially working. I don't understand the need for two sliders though and it gets messy and convoluted with more than a few categories.. I do not like it as is.

journal.title: Fixx
journal.content:
Done 
I need the weekly goals to be part of the data migration that is checked. If any of the weekly goals is not on a midnight number it needs updated to be at the correct first day of the week at midnight instead of its whatever time it is that is wrong from the short time period it was using UTC and making the times appear at different weeks. Like my goal for this week is showing up on last week since it lists it as 6pm on the last day of last week instead of 12am the first day of this week. 

The categories headers for the statuses and other task manager headers like categories or due dates also need to persist. I noticed it when I tried to close a header then clicked complete on s task and the headers all opened back up.

journal.title: Tasks bleh
journal.content:
The timer tasks do not show them counting up in real time when they are actively counting up, but it does seem to be getting the right time because when I pause or refresh it updates to the right time. It's just not displaying it in real time. 
Also a bunch of buttons seem to not be working when I open the task manager or when in task details modal or other things. Will you make sure all the buttons in the task details modal and related modals work as well as the buttons on the tasks themselves in the task manager?

journal.title: Weekly Goal
journal.content: Add in house and pilot tasks

journal.title: Fix
journal.content:
In sorting by date for journals, make the weeks collapsible headers, like where it says from strat day to end day, that should be a collapsible header and if there is nothing for a week then no header should exist. 

Also, why is it so hard for the weekly goals to just appear on the midnight hour of the first day of the week they are programmed for? I think maybe it is accounting for a time zone, but maybe it doesn't need to? I even tried deleting the ones that I have and it just put them right back at the wrong time. Will you fix the data migration that automatically runs in the background on start up to catch this and fix it? I think I'm UTC -6 right now and all my weekly goals are showing up 6 hours early so I need to fix this

journal.title: Thought for: ?
journal.content: Mostly testing is the thoughts section works. :) üß°ü•∞ü¶äüêæüõ©Ô∏èü•∞

journal.title: Invention
journal.content:
Android should do this. 

App or feature that lets one person set their phone down and then through Bluetooth transfer a feed/transcript to other phones and out and out until it reaches everyone in receive/transmit mode. In case we are all in a big location and can't hear what is going on ahead at the front of a large group. 

I think it could help for when people in the background want to be helpful to spread a word and there is no official media team transmitting it, especially not to the local people sitting just a little too far away.

journal.title: Monthly meeting notes
journal.content:
Keys in the mags after telling prop clear, but BEFORE fuel pump/magnetos.
-Cody

Tiki -esque fluid? That gets ice off wings, ATP, only cfi can do that. 

Hiring in maintenance. 

Maintaining center line and having power out BEFORE applying brakes are two signs of a professional pilot. Professionalism shows you understand the seriousness of the job. 

Today ATP allowed beards... Bum bum bummmmmm

Good pilots are ready to fly the day before. Going to sleep, hygiene, papers and forecasts. Be early. 15 minutes early probably isn't enough, but it is better and more appropriate than anything ANY but less. Just find a reason to be early.

journal.title: Weekly Goal
journal.content:
Pass Checkride, coordinate safe flight with rain delay as required. 
Drive, explore,
Share app to those interested
Hang with Kegan 
Start instrument training full sprint

journal.title: TaskManager
journal.content:
1. When I sort by icon in journal, it does not need to say fa-airplane, it just needs to show the icon of the airplane and then say "airplane" 
2. When I edit a task and it brings up the create task modal, it should be slightly adjusted so that when the user is done the button they click should say "update task" instead of create task, and if there is a header at the top it should also say update instead of create. 
3. Last time I tried to use the end repeat after option it was when I was editing a task and when I submitted the change it didn't seem to set an end date for the repeat, or at least it still kept showing up on my calendar past the date I set. Can you double check the end repeat after function if working and implemented correctly both for creating the task and for editing a current task? Thank you. 
4. Timers visually stop counting when the app/page is refreshed. But if I pause and resume the timer (on the timer task in task manager) it correctly counts up again. Will you help it to work even on page reload if it is currently supposed to be counting, please? Thank you. ü•∞

journal.title: Journal
journal.content:
Sometimes I write in my journal. :)
Today I am writing to say. 
1. Jade and I have been growing a lot together these last few years and this year in particular we have been able to talk about the things that are close to our hearts. We have been better at giving each other space (me to Jade) and taking the time to care about what each other is saying or needing (both of us to each other). It has meant we have been able to have much more close to heart conversations, though some things still seem like careful subjects, no subjects are "off-limits" anymore and this is special. üß°ü¶äüá∫üá∏
2. I am totally overwhelmed every single day trying to be a pilot. I pray so hard for help and wake up dreading each day. I feel so behind and don't know how to catch up.......

journal.title: ü§îüß°ü¶äüêæ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©π
journal.content:
I feel so small. 
Jade asked if there was anything she could do to help me destress and told me she had done meditation earlier to help with some anxiety she was having and offered to do it again with me. I said I would need to write everything in my mind to help myself destress. She said go ahead. Here I am. 

Here am I, ready and willing, here am I... Haha, sorry lyrics to a song. 

I am so stressed because I am trying to code so much and design an entire skills platform, but am not knowledgeable at piloting and need to be studying that. I suppose I could set aside time for both in this app (task manager/planner/calendar) and then hold myself to time limits and certain chores. Learning about flying is fun, but it's so chaotic I do not enjoy it! That is the whole point of the G&J Skill Tracker app. I want to make it straightforward. Beginning to end, no hubbub or pay walls, subscriptions, or confusion. Every single point.

I need to make the skill creator modal, the form, with the appropriate bullet point and indentation with automatic transformation to checkboxes that it will need. It will need to be able to be saved and reproduced in html and then will need to be able to store the checkboxes states AND have the room for dates of when things were checked last AND a spot for signatures at the prove sections, and I suppose it would be appropriate for a price section to be partially signed off, and then require another signature on another day for the rest, this meaning every checkpoint needs two signatures, but technically many many signatures could make up those two for each one, since maybe they only get through pay off the prove one day and come back another day and have different people watching each day. And maybe they have to do the prove twice anyway if they only have 1 person watching each time, though most likely they will just have 2 signatures, and it should start whether it has to be done all at once and some may even have time limits. Like baking and decorating a cake for "is it cake" and only having so many hours to do it start to finish would be a really fun prove to do with Jade and anyone else who will do it with us. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©πü¶äüêæ

Please help. I feel so small. I am not smart enough to do it all and I need help learning. 

I need the flash card app, I need the calendar/planner, I need a start to finish list of everything I need to learn for private pilot. Then I need to study it all and same for instrument which I am at the beginning of so hopefully I can do it easier, but I want to do the gis and elevate and flights and reg memorizations and PHAK chapters and POH and charts and all of it in order, start to finish. I will start on this tomorrow morning ASAP. I have no idea how hard it is or how far I can get, but I am going to need to make the skill maker first, but I can't let that take me very long. I mostly just need it to be a form with proper indentation and checkbox format. Like I submit it, and then it reads it like checkboxes, so maybe I can add another bullet OR I can create a sub bullet and this could be for all three PPPs and the required maintenance would use it to... Except it would be a little different since each required maintenance would also need a number (eg 1) and interval unit (eg month) to go with the task that needs to happen on or before the interval expires and then in the app itself it will need to keep track of when it was checked and then after the interval, uncheck it, allowing for the option to renew it as a replacement button for the checkbox since there is no reason to uncheck it. Though there could be an option to make the check box clear again but maybe at the top in the header of required maintenance. And when making the skill it should specify whether the required maintenance needs 0, 1, or 2 signatures and what the minimum level of the person at the skill is who is allowed to sign, default is level 1, but a level 0 would mean anyone could sign and a level higher would mean we are looking to be signed off by someone is more expertise or even mastery of the level is 4 or 5 being required. The amount of work to be a level 5 is all high though, almost no one is ever going to be level 5 unless it is all they do ever. Level 3 is average for a reason. It's actually impressive to get to this point and maintaining it is no slouch feat! A level 4 is so advanced it is usually as far as an overachiever need to to be seen as far ahead of the crowd. Level 5s are for crazy people who it's the only thing they care about. Like me trying to be a good husband, a good son of God, a good friend, a good pilot... All of those are "good" which is likely a level 3 if I can be so lucky and focused, maybe a level 4 over the years, but level 5? It will take me a LOOONG time to get to level 5 in those, and when I do, all the more reason to be proud of the effort and accomplishment. Remember, maintaining higher levels is harder than lower levels so seeing higher level people who are rusty is more common than you'd think. And isn't a sign they are not level 5 anymore, just that they have been focusing elsewhere in their life lately. 

I'm the G&J RPG "rusty" means you can still roll your high stat, just at disadvantage, and only a skill you have as your focus is one you are not rusty at. Sort of, rusty happens at different intervals at different levels and for different skills, but generally speaking, a skill that is lower level is going to rust slower than a skill at higher levels since the amount is precision and ability needed to perform at the peak level is so much higher than at basic or intermediate or even average levels. 


My mind... I want to put it to rest.... I need to work to make these things real so I can sleep.... üíßIn the morning I will start right away. 
1. Build the form, build the html to display it using js and json and local storage just like all the other apps on the site, make it's own page, maybe use a g&j tracker and get rid of one of them since we do not need them anymore as the system evolved from the old two skills merge to form a new one system, though that is still interesting, it will need to be in gold while I figure out whether it is compatible with the huge 5 level PPP setup I am going for rn. 

The form needs to look good on phone and on PC. Use voice to text a lot in pc to speed this up. Teach an ai how to write files in the JSON format and then upload them to help speed things up to. 
Same with tasks, upload a JSON for a single or set of tasks sounds great! 
Especially once we can export the skill tasks to the planner and then modal for picking how often you wish to complete the tasks, or maybe that can be part of making the skill, each tasks can have an estimated duration and then when it gets converted for the planner we would just choose how long we want to work on then in a day/week/month and then it would auto place them out so that they would give the user the correct amount of time to do them all start to finish starting at the exact moment the user adds them in. Eg if each one takes 1 hour and then the last one takes 3 hours and the user chooses they wish to work on it for 30 minutes a day, they would be due every other day at the time it was made, except the last one would be due 6 days out from the second to last one since that one needed 3 hours and at 30 minutes a day that would be 6 days. A simple calculation can be done with a function to plan all their due dates and then it can automatically set them to the type of task they are supposed to be, maybe as part of the skill creator in the little bullet points we can let them choose if it is count, timer or mark done as well, thus following our pattern already. There was a fourth type, but I forget it right now. 
I think it was check boxes, so if someone has multiple specific things that need done, up until now I was only doing a "count" style and then writing what each count was in the description, but what if it was actual checkboxes, maybe we have to open the task details modal to check the individual ones, or maybe it is scrollable on the task itself in the task manager view, only showing a couple lines at a time as it is scrolled and it could keep track of the total checkboxes checked over how many there are total, and once all is them are checked it could be considered done. Or even, once enough are checked it could be considered done. Which leads to nuance like with the timer or count maybe being allowed to go over so people could get extra credit basically. This could be another way to get to S and S+tier. With the extra credit! I like this a lot! So if I need to do 100 pushups a day and do 200, this would be S+ graded at the end of the day, but currently if I get to 100, it simply stops and wants to know if it is completed or not, maybe a "keep going" option is in need? And with the timer when it is over it could ask to confirm the time amount and let the user change it just in case they accidentally left it running. Same with the count I suppose, it could ask the user to confirm the amount and let them change it if they need to. This should be an option always on tinder and count, to change the quantity it is asking if they completed or partially completed. A partial completion should always be an option and a whole or over achiever completion should also be options each time too. 

ü¶äüêæI feel so small. Please help me finish these and get it to the world so I can not hurt while they are so wanting to get out from me.. I just want to be a better pilot so I can support my family and stop failing checkrides. üò≠üôè.... üíßI'm not strong enough to do this on my own, but I have to be to be a private pilot. I need help, but I have to be able to do it alone and not cry, I have to be strong, trustworthy, confident, capable, knowledgeable, smart, proficient, safe, good at it all. üõ©Ô∏èüôèüí™ Please, ...... Heal me, help me, please.... ‚òÄÔ∏èüôèüìöüó∫Ô∏èüåêüõ∞Ô∏èüõ´

journal.title: Notes *fixed
journal.content:
2 things, a timed task needs to have the complete option not just a start/pause. That way a person can more quickly bypass having finished it. 
2. Are the counts and timers correctly calculating the remaining amount of task to compare to how much time is left until due? Like with the demerits? Since a task that has 46 minutes or if 60 complete that would normally be red might in this case be only yellow. It should be a ratio applied to it.

journal.title: Existing
journal.content:
I should have busted another CheckRide today but Chris let me discontinue. He was so busy today and I just don't know how to be s good PIC. I don't know how to be in charge of my own life, how am I supposed to be in charge of a plane? 
I was so tired today but had to do the CheckRide anyway. God helped me somehow hold tolerances for everything except the full throttle stall. Power on stall, and then I couldn't remember what he meant by landing stall. My one landing I did was so bad, and I failed to do slips twice. I am going to practice those for hours in the simulator. 
I feel like my CFI doesn't have any hope for me. She was celebrating other students on the their successes and hardly had to be to say hi after mine. It's probably because she doesn't see me as often as them and overall I just need to be there more again every day like I used to be. 

I feel like such a failure, why am I even alive still? What is the purpose of Gunnar even existing?

journal.title: Edit task not working
journal.content:
When I try to "edit" a current task, and then click update task at the bottom of the form, it is not saving it, not updating it. I'm trying to fix this. Does it have something to do with how the thoughts are saved to the IDs in the future tasks area? If someone changes a Due date or repetition type the IDs might get moved around and the thoughts attached to those may get messed up. How can we fix this? Is there an industry standard way to fix or address this? Will you also check what it says in the readme and make sure it is appropriately describing the three types of tasks (not the completion types, but the actual types) historical (which are each individual and linked with common task IDs, but are each individual instances of it), current (which is also a single event, it is the next one due, and is the one being addressed by the task manager), and future (these are a calculated array, or something similar, and get remade everytime the current task is updated) if for whatever reason a thought is added to a future task and then that task is changed to be a different date, we should save that note in the journal still, but we should have a modal of some sort to link that thought to a new particular instance of that future task. Are you able to help me come up with an industry standard simple modal that can guide a user to attach the thought to the new task? If they choose not to, there can be the option to delete the thought or also just to "leave disconnected" so they know it is still in journal but not actually attached to any particular future task like it used to be. 
Also, if we are re-creating all the future tasks each time, how is the app figuring which specific future task the thought is attached to? It should probably be using the due date/start time for where to put the note in the journal list (since that sorts by date/time primarily) but does it not also have an individual Id? Like, the task has an id to connect all of the different historical, current, and future instances of it together, but then they need individual IDs too so that we can attach the thoughts to them and also to know which specific task to apply the changes to.
I suppose we could ask when a task is edited if they want the changes to apply to all future tasks too (for that current task), and then if there are thoughts attached at all it could ask our questions and help them attach the thoughts again (or whatever they choose) in the process and correct order of this edit they are making. I say correct order so it doesn't break anything that they are editing the details and they are being changed possibly for all the future tasks as well as the current. If they choose not to apply it to all future tasks too, the current one for that task no becomes the next one in the list and the edits they just made become there own instance of a task, so I guess it would need a new id and everything... That sounds messy... Is there a better way to do this???

journal.title: LOTH
journal.content: I was thinking today about what if Earth had some form of control over the gravity of earth. So for example when she starts to lose her hope and her will to keep Earth together is broken that's why gravity breaks or at least become so much less. And also unstable which is a really curious thing since generally gravity is even this would be interesting since some parts it would be less in some parts it would be more! This is very fascinating concept and probably a huge part of the whole series! I think the final boss quote unquote will be another entity like Earth who is able to control gravity but is making a black hole and possibly trying to like swallow the whole I don't know Milky Way galaxy I'm not exactly sure maybe there's another galaxy somewhere but it make more sense to be a little more close to home if it was trying to destroy something that Earth would care about and then, Earth would remember how much she cares about all the people there and she would have to grow and be able to defend against this other entity! Because without her the Galaxy would be lost. And I'm not exactly sure if we're talking just the Galaxy here or if it would be like maybe less you know maybe it's just the solar system I don't exactly know it could be that this entity has already come and taken several different solar systems maybe individual planets maybe entire galaxy I don't know but when they get to the one Earth is supposed to defend, that is where he finds out that Earth was not just another planet. And oh my gosh this is so good I definitely want to keep this! But yeah I definitely think that Earth has to be the one to finish it but I think it's kind of a story of friendship again where these three friends that work together to still be friends even through their hardship gives her hope that the rest of Earth might be able to make it too. It's a somber emotionally charged story, but we will tell it how it is and yeah I can probably make the one who takes the Hydra girl, no one has to know. In fact the one who goes with the Phoenix will probably be the most normal of the bunch that's why they help to keep the group together, the one who takes the Griffin what kind of be immature with a lot of growth needed kind of a thing. Rather endearing but definitely short on a lot of important areas for a Hero, and frankly a friend..

journal.title: Emoji idea
journal.content:
Allow emojis to be used instead of font awesome icons, the only restriction is that if the emoji doesn't exist or font awesome icons doesn't exist it should give a little red indicator asking them to choose another as "that one does not exist in our database," (though the validation should happen after checking if the font awesome icon or emoji shows up, is there a way to check this? Since sometimes font awesome has more options than we have listed so the user should still be allowed to type something like "fa-solid da-church" and it should still work, even though that one is not in our selector (which it should be, under the family tab, or maybe we could have a places tab? And the placeholder text could say something like "type an emoji or choose an icon" then if they put in too many emojis or emojis that show up as the box with the x in it or if the font awesome one comes back empty it would prompt them to change it telling them the criteria) and you can apologize, if they try to use more than 10 emojis it should also give them a red indicator apologizing that they can choose up to 10 (valid) emojis and that is it. Can you add in all the validation for this? And then if they somehow bypass the input validation there needs to be a popup modal asking them to choose a new icon apologizing since the one the previously had is not compatible (when they load back in later and it tries to load what they injected erroneously as the icon).
Of course trailing spaces or even spaces at all in the emojis should be cleaned up before saving too. The modal should appropriately apply the icon choice to the appropriate variable. Not sure how you will do this, but it can't just be saving it randomly, and the modal needs to match the app in how it looks too please. ‚ù§Ô∏è
The app should still show the icon from font awesome and then the name of that icon in the sort by icon view, but for emojis, it will only display the emoji, no text (though if they choose to put text in there that is okay, it should just follow the rules that no more than 10 characters total can be used. Which I guess means maybe that is the most important validation and if they try to use an invalid emoji it should warn them, but text or numbers/signs and of any language should be okay as long as it isn't more than 10 symbols, signs, or characters/emojis long.)
Also, when I update a current task it doesn't show any changes, but it does remember it for a little bit since if I open the modal to edit the task again the changes are still showing the new values, but when I refresh and any attempt to see the updates showing up on the app(like checking if the due date changed how long it takes to complete expected time, etc.) doesn't seem to be recognizing the change. And again when I refresh the page the change is gone.

journal.title: Jorge y su esposa
journal.content:
Jorge, I didn't catch his last name and I can not remember his wife's name, but they work at the Subway at the junction in Ogden and have been there 2 years and came here from Lima where they're from. 
Super nice, said he would call me up if the every made Chicha Morada, a purple corn drink, super yummy and thick! ü•∞
I have him my name and phone number. 
He asked if I was a member of the Church and I teased him back saying Yes and then questioningly that I probably didn't need to specify which church and we proceeded to talk about missions and Peru and their subway was really clean I need to go back to ask for brother Ernesto who Jade said could live with us still (she brought it up yesterday) if he found a way to be here and work legally still! So I have to ask Jorge about this. Maybe another Saturday afternoon? What was it? 2 o clock ish? 2:30 maybe?

journal.title: Vacations not working and daylight savings time
journal.content:
Vacation should list in the all day section of the calendar when there is vacation. Also, the all day isn't really a feature in the app so could we retitle that section vacation? And only display it if there is a vacation that the user has programmed, like if there are no vacations or doesn't show up, but it there is even one, it does? Also I put my dates in for November 27th till the 28th and it took all the tasks from the 26th and 27th and put them on the 28th. That is not how that is supposed to work. It seems to have correctly identified which tasks to move based on my preferences in advanced options, but then it erroneously moves the wrong dates and to the wrong date. It should be pushing them all up to *before* the first day so the 26th and adjusting everything back in time like that. And then it should be using the correct dates like the 27th and 28th for telling which tasks to move, not the 26th since I didn't write that one in. Any ideas why this is happening and how to fix it? 

Oh and and as a side note, I don't think daylight savings time is working. Doesn't javascript use local time? So why are my tasks 1 hour off now that daylight savings time is over? Maybe there can be some kind of check for this? But also, if it is just using local time it shouldn't matter right? It doesn't have to convert any time zones and also just like I wake up and my phone is already set to the right time, if it is just reading the phone's clock, it shouldn't be wrong, right?
